entry.title: Bohemian: Responsive Pelican Theme
entry.summary:
About

Source Code

Bohemian is a pelican theme I wrote to use here on my github page, replacing my older Clean theme. It’s Free, Responsive, Open Source, & Typographically Tasteful; built to provide a great reading experience with minimal clutter, Bohemian will ready your Pelican site for 21st century.

Features

  • Fully Responsive
  • Lightweight
  • Typeset in the beautiful Alegreya, served by Brick for blazing speed.
  • Two Handsome Subthemes build on the same base … the one on this site and the theme used by Science Class
  • Modern, clutter free design makes for a great reading experience.
  • Option to use text or image for the logo

Technology

Bohemian makes use of the wonderful Pelican, Python, Typeplate.css, Pygments syntax highlighting, and Brick webfonts.

entry.title: Algebrarules.com
entry.summary:
About

View Site // Source Code

Algebrarules.com provides the most useful Rules of Algebra in one place: easy to understand, free, search-able, and accompanied by informative descriptions and examples.

These simple rules — applied with a pinch of imagination and a dash of arithmetic — can divide, conquer, and solve just about any basic algebra problem.

This is a collaboration between myself and Photosythesis; I built the site and he did the math.

Technology

This one uses PHP with the data stored — for simplicity, but at the cost of style points — in an a array. It makes use of of Jquery, as well as Meanmenu, Typeplate.css, Hint.css, Fittext.js, and Mathjax.

entry.title: Emspectrum.info
entry.summary:
A Visual Tour of the Electromagnetic Spectrum

Contribute to Repo

The Electromagnetic Spectrum pervades everything. The sounds in your ears; the words you speak; the cellphone you love to distraction; the radio and TV that blare in the background — even the light from this screen hitting your eyes. Do you understand it?

emspectrum.info will allow you to discover the wonders of the ubiquitous electromagnetic spectrum.

Technology

At the moment the SVGs are being generated with a python script and the data is stored in a MySQL DB. Emspectrum.info in under develoment, and we will be opening for signups shortly. The GitHub repo is currently empty, but drop and line if you’re interested in contributing.

entry.title: Automathic.org
entry.summary:
View Site


About

This was one of the first forays I made into serious web development. I have not open-sourced it yet because the code is a mess, but I intend to when I have a chance to clean it up a bit.

Technology

Automathic is built on PHP/MySQL, with as little JavaScript as possible.

It uses a good bit of third-party code, including PHPMarkdown, a user system written by Photosythesis, Hint.css, Mathjax, Jquery, and Entypo Pictograms. It doesn’t use Bootstrap.
